product_description: C2TE S1 grey tile adhesive with CO2 emissions  fully offset in the entire life cycle
recyclable_percentage_description: Through available C&D recycling facilities in each state
end_of_life_program_description: Available C&D recycling facilities in each state
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: optimised product stacking and placement in trucks. backloading trucks where possible, standard truck idling avoidance
minimisation_design_strategy: Refer to limitiations in the TDS and installation guidelines.
installation_risks_description: free crystalline silica (Ø >10 µ) - Care must be taken and the during the opening of bags, mixing and processing of products. Use appropriate PPE. Safety Data Sheet must be refereed to.
applied_finish_required_description: Mixed with water in accordance with the Technical Data Sheet and applied by trowel.
other_comments:
KERAFLEX MAXI S1 ZERO is part of the CO2 Fully Offset in the Entire Life Cycle line of products. CO2 emissions measured throughout the life cycle of products from the Zero line in 2024 using Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) methodology, verified and certified with EPDs, have been offset through the acquisition of certified carbon credits in support of forestry protection projects. A commitment to the planet, to people and to biodiversity. For more details on how emissions are calculated and on climate mitigation projects financed through certified carbon credits, visit the webpage zero.mapei.com.

For work method statements including the most common application of Keraflex Maxi S1 Zero visit https://www.mapei.com/au/en/products-and-solutions/solutions/solutions-list?product=keraflex-maxi-s1
type_of_packaging: Paper bags (with PET internal lining). 89.9 % recyclable (for available local streams)

product_description: A replacement for GP Cement with 30% less carbon and comparable strength performance and workability
recyclable_percentage_description: Low Carbon Cement is used to create concrete or mortar which can be recycled into other construction materials at concrete recycling facilities
recyclable_offcuts_description: Low Carbon Cement is used to create concrete or mortar which can be recycled into other construction materials at concrete recycling facilities
recycled_content_description: The product contains fly ash which is a waste product from coal fired power stations and is compliant to AS3582.1
minimisation_design_strategy: Low Carbon Cement is used to create concrete or mortar which can be recycled into other construction materials at concrete recycling facilities
other_comments:
Cement Australia has developed a new product called Low Carbon Cement in 20kg bags as a direct replacement for GP Cement 20kg bags.  Low Carbon Cement is a blend of GP Cement, Fly Ash and proprietary additives to achieve a product that provides both a 30% carbon reduction relative to GP Cement, whilst also maintaining comparable strength performance and workability to GP Cement.  Cement Australia has already received positive feedback from a number of field trials across Melbourne indicating that there was no difference in performance to GP.  Low Carbon Cement complies with the Type GB requirements of Australian Standard AS3972 and will be supported by an independently verified Environmental Product Declaration (EPD).  

Cement Australia is leading the construction industry with a clear solution to reduce embodied carbon in concrete and mortar without compromising on strength performance or compliance to Australian Standards, and support our societies need to decarbonisation and reach net zero emissions by 2050.
type_of_packaging: Paper sacks are used for packaging which can be recycled

product_description: 100% permeable surface area, high slip resistance: Infiltration, Retention, UHI, tree health, WSUD
price_adjustment_structure: Up to 16% more depending on colour options
lead_time: Light Grey and Charcoal in stock. Larger quantities can require 8 weeks. Delivery 1 to 2 weeks.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Offcuts can be crushed and used for road gravel, revetments, retaining walls, landscaping gravel, or raw material for new concrete.
reusable_description: Yes,  at the end of life product can be crushed and used for road gravel, revetments, retaining walls, landscaping gravel, or raw material for new concrete.
minimisation_design_strategy: Choose appropriate paver size and laying pattern for project purposes.
installation_risks_description: Silica content: When cutting the pavers with a wet saw on site,it’s required to wear masks to mitigate the risk of inhaling silica dust.
other_comments:
Human Health and Safety
HydroSTON pavers help create safer living environments by reducing surface water buildup, which can lead to hazardous conditions like slips and falls. Their permeability also minimises the risk of flooding, contributing to a safer and more resilient community infrastructure. By preventing the accumulation of standing water, these pavers help reduce the breeding grounds for mosquitoes, contributing to better public health outcomes.

Climate Resilience
One of the key climate-related benefits of HydroSTON pavers is their ability to mitigate the urban heat island effect. By allowing water to permeate through the surface and into the ground, these pavers help cool the surrounding environment, which is particularly important in densely built urban areas. This cooling effect not only enhances comfort for residents but also reduces the demand for air conditioning, lowering energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

Social Equity
HydroCon is committed to promoting social equity by ensuring that their products are accessible and beneficial to all communities. The company focuses on sourcing materials responsibly and working with local suppliers to support regional economies. By integrating HydroSTON pavers into public spaces, municipalities can create more inclusive environments that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing, benefiting a diverse range of people.

Circularity and Sustainable Materials
HydroSTON pavers are designed with circularity in mind. They are made from high-quality materials. The production process aims to minimise the carbon footprint. Furthermore, at the end of their lifecycle, these pavers can be recycled or repurposed, supporting a circular economy and reducing the environmental impact of construction projects.

product_description: Modular garden tray with water reservoir and wicking
recyclable_percentage_description: THe main component- tub and the internal drain cell can be sent to plastic recycling
recyclable_offcuts_description: tray offcuts are sent to recycling
recycling_process_description: High molecular weight polyethylene and polypropylene ca be recycled back into the same raw material
reusable_description: The product is modular and free standing and can be used in different locations
end_of_life_program_description: Our business takes back and repurposes trays that are not required
minimisation_design_strategy: The trays come in 1200 x 1200 size and should be laid out in most efffecient formats.  The trays can be cut to any shape and then plastic welded.  If bespoke shapes required then can the offcut also be welded and reformed to be used as a separae tray.
other_comments:
Product contains 86 - 132 mm of water reservoir.  Can be adjusted for stormwater retention and detention requirements.
Thermal insulation - Turf.  R Value 0.82 | Garden 0.91. | Deep garden tray 1.09
SUB IRRIGATION & WICKING
Internal water refill system.
Plumbed in or free standing elements.
Compatible with standard hose snap lock fittings and other irrigation systems.
Pressure compensated design ensures uniform water distribution across all trays.
Daisy chain trays together for simplified, scalable irrigation setup.
